get.summary: Gets the list of all referenced accounts (FTP/Mail) or an empty list
get.description: Gets the list of all referenced accounts (FTP/Mail) or an empty list

put.summary: Updates the whole list of accounts. Normally, with ARCs this would be one FTP account.

get.summary: Returns the own UserName, the own Role and the CustomerAdmin of the same group and Dialogs that should be shown to the user

put.summary: Confirms that the user has seen (and confirmed) the dialog

post.summary:
Try to add an existing LoRa device by its EUI such as "009D6B0000AAD392".
If the device is not already assigned to another customer then it is assigned to the customers group.

get.summary:
Gets information of all devices.
See https://docs.kolibricloud.ch/cloud-interfaces/api/access_details/

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. Skips the given number of devices. The opposite of Take.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. Takes only the first .. devices. The opposite of Skip. When not specified the API replies with the first 50 devices.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. Text term to filter all devices. Only the devices with searchText in the name or network

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. Default it is sort by the deviceâ€™s "Name". It is also possible to sort for "NetworkNode", "TransferType", "GsmNumber", "EuiNumber", "SerialNumber"

parameters.name: sortAscending
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. If False then the list of the devices is ordered in descending order.

get.summary:
Returns json data about a specific accessible device.
See https://docs.kolibricloud.ch/cloud-interfaces/api/access_details/

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: REQUIRED. Every device has an 4 digit id number. The deviceId is the same number that can be seen in the URL of the WebApp when the device is selected: https://www.kolibricloud.ch/devices/1234/

post.summary: Hides the device by null-ing of TenantId and changing SerialNumber

Send down a 'void' configuration that triggers the sending of an actual configuration from the device.
Text-content: "#E/e"

Produces a text file with the request to send missing measurement data
See chapter 1.2.3.1 of the Cellular Protocol.
Example: Requesting data from 21.3.2021 - 24.3.2021 : "#e/a=669600000/b=669859200#E/e"
Be aware: The amount of data a device can send is limited. It will start with the oldest time and sends as much a needed or possible.

Produces a text file with the request to change the device time
See chapter 1.2.3.1 of the Cellular Protocol.
Example: Changing the datetime of the device 2 days into the future is this: "#e/t=+172800#E/e"
Example: Subtracts 10min from the Device time: "#e/t=-600#E/e"
Be aware: When changing the device's time, the measurement gathering will be stopped and re-starts with the new time. In this process you might loose unsent data.
Be aware: +/- 2 days is the max time span to be able to change. It is possible to send this request multiple times  ... with the according risk.

get.summary: Gets the export file with calculated measurements

parameters.name: deviceIds
parameters.description: The devices filter for the export file.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The from date time filter for the export file. Must be UTC in format .

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end date time filter for the export file. Must be UTC.

parameters.name: measurementDefinitionIds
parameters.description: The measurement definition ids to be filtered for the export file.

parameters.name: exportFileType
parameters.description: The export file type. Use 0 for CSV, 1 for Excel, 2 for Zip, 4 for Hydras, 5 for AquaInfo, 6 for KOLIBRI JSON.

get.summary: Gets the export file with calculated measurements

parameters.name: deviceIds
parameters.description: The devices filter for the export file.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The from date time filter for the export file. Must be UTC in format .

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end date time filter for the export file. Must be UTC.

parameters.name: measurementDefinitionIds
parameters.description: The measurement definition ids to be filtered for the export file.

parameters.name: exportFileType
parameters.description: The export file type. Use 3 for DOCX or 9 for PDF

put.summary: Sends down 1..3 FlowCalculationSettings that needs to be updated

Updates only one list of settings from one of the 5 sensors.
This list is normally filled with 1 setting. When it has more than the ones with filled From/TO are history-settings

get.summary: Gets the assigned roles of the actually authenticated user.

generalAlarmMailReceiversCommaSeparated.description: List of mail addresses of recipients of alarm mails triggered by a troublesome system state

ftpMailAccounts.description:
List of FTP or MAIL accounts that belong to the same Tenant.
Normally, with ARCs, there should be one FTP account.
LoRa devices or groups without dedicated account return a empty list

AdministrationSettingsModel.description: Like AdministrationSettings but without ID and Tenant

totalRecords.description: Count of all alarms that are filtered. Is used by frontend to calculate "table" Take/Skip values

waterCalculationId.description: For Water Calculation it is needed to have a link to the Water Calculation that can be one from the past (not the actual one)

valueUnitId.description:
Unused for now.
Might be needed to calculate the Value into/fromto the user specific unit.
Maybe the UnitId from MeasurementDefinition can be taken

sendAlarmOffMessage.description: When an Alarm does not anymore fullfill the alarm condition than the user might want to be notified

levelAlarmIsHigher.description:
True (1) : In LevelAlarm, when the Alarm is triggered when the actual value is HIGHER than the "LevelAlarmValue"
False(0) : In LevelAlarm, when the Alarm is triggered when the actual value is LOWER  than the "LevelAlarmValue"

levelAlarmHysteresisValue.description:
Used by LevelAlarm: After triggering an alarm it might go into a state where multiple alarms are
triggered because the level swings back and forth just crossing the alarm level.
This value is a buffer to limit the alarm trigger.

deltaTimeAlarmTimeSpanInMinutes.description:
In DeltaTimeAlarms, when the choosen "Channel"-difference during DeltaTimeAlarmTimeSpanInMinutes
is bigger than the DeltaAlarmDifferenceValue

alternativeAlarmOnMailSubjectText.description:
Alternative Subject-Text to be used in a Alarm-ON-Mail
max 100 chars

alternativeAlarmOnMailBodyText.description:
Alternative Body-Text to be used in a Alarm-ON-Mail
max 2000 chars

alternativeAlarmOffMailSubjectText.description:
Alternative Subject-Text to be used in a Alarm-OFF-Mail
max 100 chars

alternativeAlarmOffMailBodyText.description:
Alternative Body-Text to be used in a Alarm-OFF-Mail
max 2000 chars

waterCalculationId.description: For Water Calculation it is needed to have a link to the Water Calculation that can be one from the past (not the actual one)

valueUnitId.description:
Unused for now.
Might be needed to calculate the Value into/fromto the user specific unit.
Maybe the UnitId from MeasurementDefinition can be taken

sendAlarmOffMessage.description: When an Alarm does not anymore fulfill the alarm condition than the user might want to be notified

levelAlarmIsHigher.description:
True (1) : In LevelAlarm, when the Alarm is triggered when the actual value is HIGHER than the "LevelAlarmValue"
False(0) : In LevelAlarm, when the Alarm is triggered when the actual value is LOWER  than the "LevelAlarmValue"

levelAlarmHysteresisValue.description:
Used by LevelAlarm: After triggering an alarm it might go into a state where multiple alarms are
triggered because the level swings back and forth just crossing the alarm level.
This value is a buffer to limit the alarm trigger.

deltaTimeAlarmTimeSpanInMinutes.description:
In DeltaTimeAlarms, when the choosen "Channel"-difference during DeltaTimeAlarmTimeSpanInMinutes
is bigger than the DeltaAlarmDifferenceValue

isAlarmStateOn.description: When true the alarm state of the device with this alarm setting is ON

alternativeAlarmOnMailSubjectText.description:
Alternative Subject-Text to be used in a Alarm-ON-Mail
max 100 chars

alternativeAlarmOnMailBodyText.description:
Alternative Body-Text to be used in a Alarm-ON-Mail
max 2000 chars

alternativeAlarmOffMailSubjectText.description:
Alternative Subject-Text to be used in a Alarm-OFF-Mail
max 100 chars

alternativeAlarmOffMailBodyText.description:
Alternative Body-Text to be used in a Alarm-OFF-Mail
max 2000 chars

alarmState.description:
Active (0) This alarm is active
Confirmed (1) This alarm is active but has been manually confirmed (LevelON/LevelOFF alarms)
AlarmOff  (2) This alarm has a state where it is not active anymore
AlarmOffAndConfirmed (3) This alarm's alarm-value is OK again. It has been manually confirmed (LevelON/LevelOFF alarms) and automatically confirmed because the value is OK again (Device alarms)

CustomizedChannelPostModel.description: Like the entity CustomizedChannel but without the Id

creationDateTime.description:
Indicate if it was sent from the WebApp or manually through GSMSetup/GSMDatamanager
The ACK Id is either a number (Sent from the API) which is smaller than 65000 (Id%65000==Ack-Id) or it is 0 (Sent from GSMSetup/Datamanager)

lockTimerMeasurement.description:
SHOULD ALWAYS BE ON
#c/x (read only) AND #c/y (write only), Bit Position 0

lockTimerCheck.description:
SHOULD ALWAYS BE ON 
#c/x (write only) AND #c/y (read only), Bit Position 3

lockTimerDial.description:
SHOULD ALWAYS BE OFF
#c/x (read only) AND #c/y (write only), Bit Position 4

measurementSendFTP.description:
#f/z, Bit Position 0
LETS NOT DO THIS ANYMORE FOR KOLIBRI

measurementSendFtpAfterX.description:
#f/q
LETS NOT DO THIS ANYMORE FOR KOLIBRI

waterLevelCalculationCalculateFrom.description: #c/8, 0 = P1-P2 | 1 = P1-PBaro | 2 = P1 relative | 3 = not defined

waterLevelCalculationConversionTo.description:
#c/9, 0 = Height of water above level sensor (E) | 1 = Distance to water surface (F)
2 = Height of water above sea level (G) | 3 = Overflow (Poleni) | 4 = Overflow (Thomson)

saveInterval.description:
The measure interval in minutes
In LoRa devices: TransmissionInterval==SaveInterval

newChangeItemText.description: This is a text representation of the new setting/configuration/change

oldChangeItemText.description:
Can be null. If not null: Should be JSON string.
When changes can be compared, then it makes sense to show the old value for a comparison

deviceId.description: If null then it is a group specific log (not device specific)

flowCalculationSettings.description: List of 3 FlowCalculation identified by the MeasurementDefinitionId

FlowCalculationSettingsGetPutModel.description: List of 3 FlowCalculation identified by the MeasurementDefinitionId

password.description: The account's password. IN PLAIN TEXT. Sorry.

id.description: Reference id to the FtpAccount-Row-Id rsp. the MailAccount-Row-Id

isAccountMailNotFtp.description:
Either it is a FTP account or a Mail account. FTP account is very much preferred.
False: FTP / True: Mail / Default: False

ftpAccountPassword.description: The account's password. IN PLAIN TEXT. Sorry.

ftpAccountRestrictToDevicesCommaSeparate.description: List of devices to use. If NULL or "" then ALL devices will be used.

ftpAccountFolderStructure.description: When there is a valid folder name then not the FTP root will be taken but the new folder structure on top of the root.

active.description:
Is the user still active are meant to be removed from the group?
True: Active, False: Should not see data and is meant to be removed

userName.description: The user's name from AAD B2C

emailAddress.description:
The user's E-Mail address used for authorization.
It's unclear if this is possible to extract from AAD B2C

networkVisibility.description: List of networks the user has access to.

registeredLatitude.description: Is 0 when no value is stored

registeredLongitude.description: Is 0 when no value is stored

triangulatedLatitude.description:
Does work with 2G, 3G but it won't work anymore with newer mobile chip module
Is 0 when no value is stored

triangulatedLongitude.description:
Does work with 2G, 3G but it won't work anymore with newer mobile chip module
Is 0 when no value is stored

altitudeInMeters.description:
Altitude set by user. There is no triangulated altitude
Is 0 when no value is stored

ownUserName.description: This is the username the user used to login

customerAdministrators.description: List of CustomerAdministrator of the same group. Normally, this should be 1 person.

MeUser.description: Model class with information about Returns the own UserName, the own Role and the CustomerAdmin of the same group

MeasurementViewModel.description: This should be in sync with \Entities\Data\MeasurementDefinition.cs

lastDataRangeTimeSpan.description: If "LastDataRangeTimeSpan" is not null: Get Measurements from RangeEnd=now, RangeStar=now-TimeSpanRange

customRangeStartUtc.description:
IF CustomRangeStartUtc is not null and CustomRangeEndUtc is not null: Get Measurements from RangeEnd=CustomRangeEndUtc, RangeStar=CustomRangeStartUtc
IF both LastDataRangeTimeSpan and CustomRangeStartUtc are null then get ALL data

customRangeEndUtc.description:
IF CustomRangeStartUtc is not null and CustomRangeEndUtc is not null: Get Measurements from RangeEnd=CustomRangeEndUtc, RangeStar=CustomRangeStartUtc
IF both LastDataRangeTimeSpan and CustomRangeEndUtc are null then get ALL data

to.description: If null then this is the actual configuration

historyRemarks.description: A text field that might contain information of earlier used calculation based on sent (device) configurations

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Get the temporary bearer token from https://www.kolibricloud.ch/user-settings.
Bearer.name: Authorization
